name: IoT is the next wave:

venue.name: Google Johannesburg
venue.address_1: Golden Oak House, Bally Oaks Office Park, 35 Ballyclare Dr, Bryanston

group.name: Google Developer Group (GDG) Cloud Johannesburg Meetup

description:
There have been massive shifts in technology from Networking and the ubiquitous Mobile Device to massive increases in Cloud computing. Whats causing these technology shifts are advances in Tech and new business models. Brett StClair ExGoogler gone Banker, and and now moving into the world of Entrepreneurship will share his view on the exponential growth of the IoT opportunity. You can also catch Brett on Cliffcentrals Futurology show every Wednesday at 12:00

Dhiren Tahilram, specialized cloud consultant, and Kimoon Kim, Siatik's Google Cloud Trainer, will deep dive into Google Cloud Services supporting IoT. Googles IoT services are currently in Beta with limited access. Here is your chance to get a early view on how Cloud will support and simplify Development on the Cloud for a world of sensors.

Cheers

Brett

name: Google Container Engine and the impact of Containerization and Kubernetes

venue.name: Google Johannesburg
venue.address_1: Golden Oak House, Bally Oaks Office Park, 35 Ballyclare Dr, Bryanston

group.name: Google Developer Group (GDG) Cloud Johannesburg Meetup

description:
First talk will start at 5pm

Speaker 1:

Christian Hagner

Head of Cloud Services for Siatik who is a leader in the African infrastructure landscape for the past 17 years. He has focused on infrastructure modernisation and how to adopt new technology to improve efficiency and reduce costs by focusing on building and deploying cloud platforms

Topic: Christian will provide an overview of PaaS and SaaS and how it can minimize effort and cost in comparison to traditional IaaS solutions. Especially on the impact of containerization and kubernetes

25 Minutes

Speaker 2

Daniel Lee 

B.Sc(Eng) in Mechatronics from UCT.

He began his career as a consultant building software for industrial processing plants on mines around the country, predominantly focussing on acid mine drainage before moving to dotModus where he now designs data pipelines for big data. His experience has expanded to meet customer demands across the globe. He is very well versed in the GCP stack and boasts expert experience with Pub/Sub, App engine Flex, Kubernetes, Compute Engine, Stackdriver, BigQuery, CloudSQL and Cloud Storage. He spends most of his time working with Apache Airflow when he is not creating connectors to get data from various sources into GCP.

Topic: Google Container Engine(GKE), using airflow as an example to show a good use case for using Google Container Engine.

Short intro to Google Container Engine(GKE)

Demo of how a Container engine instance can run(using Airflow and multiple pods and containers.)

Stack driver monitoring in GKE and custom metrics.

45 Minutes

name: Learn how to Build What’s Next with Google Cape Town

venue.name: Cape Town International Convention Centre
venue.address_1: Convention Square 1 Lower Long St Cape Town

group.name: Google Developer Group (GDG) Cloud Johannesburg Meetup

description:
Please make sure to register for this event on the link below and not just on meetup otherwise you will not be able to attend.

Cloud OnBoard Event

Cloud OnBoard is a one day training course, held on September 28 
09:00 AM - 06:00 PM 
Welcome Registration 
Module 1 Introducing Google Cloud Platform 
Module 2 Getting Started with Projects 
Break 
Module 3 Google Compute Engine 
Module 4 Google Container Engine 
Module 5 Google App Engine 
Lunch 
Module 6 Google Cloud Datastore & Cloud Storage 
Module 7 Google Cloud SQL 
Module 8 Google BigQuery 
Module 9 Support and Resources

name: Big Query, Machine learning and IOT.

venue.name: Momentum
venue.address_1: 268 West Avenue, Centurion, 0057

group.name: Google Developer Group (GDG) Cloud Johannesburg Meetup

description:
In Collaboration with the Developer User Group 

Hosted by Candice Mesk

Speakers and Presentations 

Prinavan Pillay

Prinavan Pillay leads the Google Cloud Training and Specialized Consulting teams at Siatik, a Google Cloud Partner for Africa. With an academic background in both Biomedical and Electrical Engineering, his focus involves driving technological innovation and empowering others with the tools required to help businesses scale and grow with the latest cloud technologies. As a Google certified trainer, Prinavan also works directly with the Johannesburg Center of Software Engineering (JCSE) and Wits University to provide Google Cloud Training Courses for both public and private sector. Prinavan’s personal research and areas of expertise involve using the Google Cloud machine learning stack to solve data driven problems in Africa.

Talk: Prinavan will provide an introduction to the  Google Cloud Platform, highlighting the 3 main components:

Data (ML, Analytics, Data) Infrastructure (Compute Engine) Solution Development (Google App Engine Platform as a service) Local Case studies in SA on Google Cloud

15 minutes

Kimoon Kim

Kimoon Kim is a Google Certified Cloud Trainer, with an academic background in both Biomedical and Electrical Engineering. He serves as a Co-Organizer of the GDG Cloud Johannesburg and GDG Cape Town and is well-known in the GCP community for speaking on machine learning, big data and dark data on Google. His research addresses a variety of topics relating to Human-Computer Interface and Computer Vision with Machine Learning. He has assisted and enabled numerous startups to scale by incorporating machine learning and data science approaches on the Google Cloud Platform.

Talk: We will develop a machine learning model to predict the demand for taxi cabs in New York using BigQuery & TensorFlow

25 Minutes

Dhiren Tahilram

Dhiren is a Specialized Cloud Consultant at Saitik. His Background is in Computer Science and has extensive experience working with Google Cloud Products and wireless sensor networks. He also serves as a Co-Organizer of the GDG Cloud Johannesburg and GDG Cape Town groups.  

Talk: Dhiren’s talk will be on focussed on Google Cloud IoT Core:

Scalable back-end design for IOT systems with Google Cloud Integration into Analytics platforms to gain deeper insight into wireless sensor networks

25 Minutes

15 Minute Q&A

name: A Live Podcast that Explores the world of IoT (The Internet of Things).

venue.name: Siatik, Jupiter House
venue.address_1: 42 Homestead Rd

group.name: Google Developer Group (GDG) Cloud Johannesburg Meetup

description:
• What we'll do
Please register for this on https://www.meetup.com/W_T_F_Now/events/vxcmkpyxfbsb/

Join our first #WTF Livecast on the Internet of Things (IoT)?

Brett StClair and myself will be running a WTF Live Podcast Recording with our #IoT guest. We will dig into the world of #IoT and what it means going forward - and we would love to have you join us. As a member of the interactive audience, you get to interact and engage with the #WTF Podcast, ask the IoT questions that have bugged you and to be part of the interactive audience.

After the recording has been completed it will be posted live to the https://www.wtfcrowd.com Podcasting platform.

• What to bring
Nothing needed

• Important to know

name: Google Cloud Platform Fundamentals: Core Infrastructure

venue.name: Google Office
venue.address_1: Golden Oak House, Ballyoakes Office Park, 35 Ballyclare Drive, Bryanston

group.name: Google Developer Group (GDG) Cloud Johannesburg Meetup

description:
Please register on

https://events.withgoogle.com/core-infra-423160/

This one-day instructor-led class provides an overview of Google Cloud Platform products and services. Through a combination of presentations, demos, and hands-on labs, participants learn the value of Google Cloud Platform and how to incorporate cloud-based solutions into business strategies.

Objectives
This course teaches participants the following skills:

Identify the purpose and value of each of the Google Cloud Platform products and services.

Interact with Google Cloud Platform services.

Describe ways in which customers have used Google Cloud Platform.

Choose among and use application deployment environments on Google Cloud Platform: App Engine, Container Engine, and Compute Engine.

Choose among and use Google Cloud Platform storage options: Cloud Storage, Cloud SQL, Cloud Bigtable, and Cloud Datastore.

Make basic use of BigQuery, Google’s managed data warehouse for analytics.

Make basic use of Cloud Deployment Manager, Google’s tool for creating and managing cloud resources through templates. Make basic use of Google Stackdriver, Google’s monitoring, logging, and diagnostics system.

Audience
This class is intended for:

Individuals planning to deploy applications and create application environments on Google Cloud Platform;

Developers, systems operations professionals, and solution architects getting started with Google Cloud Platform;

Executives and business decision makers evaluating the potential of Google Cloud Platform to address their business needs.

Prerequisites
Familiarity with the Linux command line, web servers, and text editors.

Delivery Method
Instructor-led, Instructor-led online

Duration
One day

What to bring
For this class, please bring:

Laptop (Windows, Mac OS or Linux)

Photo ID - needed for security

name: Google Cloud Big Data & Machine Learning Fundamentals

venue.name: Google Office
venue.address_1: Golden Oak House, Ballyoakes Office Park, 35 Ballyclare Drive, Bryanston

group.name: Google Developer Group (GDG) Cloud Johannesburg Meetup

description:
Please register on: https://events.withgoogle.com/big-data-426083/

Course Description
This one-day instructor-led course introduces participants to the big data capabilities of Google Cloud Platform. Through a combination of presentations, demos, and hands-on labs, participants get an overview of the Google Cloud platform and a detailed view of the data processing and machine learning capabilities. This course showcases the ease, flexibility, and power of big data solutions on Google Cloud Platform.

Objectives
This course teaches participants the following skills:
1) Identify the purpose and value of the key Big Data and Machine Learning products in the Google Cloud Platform.

2) Use Cloud SQL and Cloud Dataproc to migrate existing MySQL and Hadoop/Pig/Spark/Hive workloads to Google Cloud Platform.

3) Employ BigQuery and Cloud Datalab to carry out interactive data analysis.

4) Train and use a neural network using TensorFlow.

5) Employ ML APIs.

6) Choose between different data processing products on the Google Cloud Platform.

Audience
This class is intended for the following:
Data analysts, Data scientists, Business analysts getting started with Google Cloud Platform.

Individuals responsible for designing pipelines and architectures for data processing, creating and maintaining machine learning and statistical models, querying datasets, visualizing query results and creating reports.

Executives and IT decision makers evaluating Google Cloud Platform for use by data scientists.

Prerequisites
To get the most of out of this course, participants should have:
1) Basic proficiency with common query language such as SQL.

2) Experience with data modeling, extract, transform, load activities.

3) Developing applications using a common programming language such Python.

4) Familiarity with machine learning and/or statistics.

Duration
One day

Delivery Method
Instructor-led, Instructor-led online

What to bring
For this class, please bring:

Laptop (Windows, Mac OS or Linux)

Photo ID - needed for security
